Content: Excise officials in Gampaha have raided a cigar manufacturing centre which was operating without a license. 9000 cigars, 50 kilogrammes of tobacco pieces and some equipment were recovered from the location. It is revealed that the produce has been distributed countrywide. Meanwhile six suspects who were conspiring to sell two pieces of ivory without a license have been arrested from the Kelaniya area. They had planned to sell them for 1.5 million rupees.  The Peliyagoda Police said that these suspects were due to be produced in the Hulftsdorp Magistrate’s Court.
